surface
Class Surface

java.lang.Object
  surface.Surface
Direct Known Subclasses:
DoubleCone, EnnepersSurface, FishSurface, Horn, JetSurface, MoebiusStrip, Pillow, PQTorus, RotationalSolid, Shell, SnailSurface, Sphere, SphereHarmonics, Spring, SuperDuperShape, SuperEllipsoid, SurfaceMorpher, TearDrop, TetrahedralEllipse, Torus, TrianguloidTrefoil, WhitneyUmbrella
public class Surface
extends java.lang.Object

This is the basic surface class all the other surface extend from.

Constructor Detail

Surface

public Surface(processing.core.PGraphics i_g,
               int i_phiSteps,
               int i_thetaSteps,
               float i_minTheta,
               float i_maxTheta,
               float i_minPhi,
               float i_maxPhi,
               float[] i_parameter,
               int[][] i_colors)
Parameters:
i_g - a PGraphics Object where your surface will drawn on, mainly this is g
i_phiSteps - the horizontal resolution of your surface
i_thetaSteps - the vertical resolution of your surface
i_minTheta - the minimal value of theta
i_maxTheta - the maximal value of theta
i_minPhi - the minimal value of phi
i_maxPhi - the maximal value of phi
i_parameter - some surface, like SuperShapes or the SnailSurface, can be initialized with different parameters

Parameters:

Method Detail

phiSteps

public int phiSteps()
Returns:
int, the horizontal resolution of your surface

thetaSteps

public int thetaSteps()
Returns:
int, the vertical resolution of your surface

coords

public float[][][] coords()
Use this method to get an array holding the coordinates of the surface. The array is organized in the form [phi][theta][x,y,z]

Returns:
float[][][], the complete coordinate array in the form [phi][theta][x,y,z]

getCoord

public float[] getCoord(int i_indexPhi,
                        int i_indexTheta)
Use this method to get the xyz coordinate for a given point on the surface

Parameters:
i_indexPhi - int, a value between 0 and phiSteps
i_indexTheta - int, a value between 0 and thetaSteps
Returns:
float[], an array with the x,y,z coordinates

setScale

public void setScale(float i_scale)
Sets the scale of the surface. Every coordinate will multiplied with the given value. It is also possible to use three values for a different scaling in xyz direction.

Parameters:
i_scale - float, the value that will be multiplied with the x,y and z coordinates

setScale

public void setScale(float i_xScale,
                     float i_yScale,
                     float i_zScale)
Parameters:
i_xScale - the value that will be multiplied with the x coordinates
i_yScale - the value that will be multiplied with the y coordinates
i_zScale - the value that will be multiplied with the z coordinates

setPointScaleDifference

public void setPointScaleDifference(int i_IndexPhi,
                                    int i_IndexTheta,
                                    float i_pointScaleDifference)
Use this methode to change the scale of every point individually . The value i_pointScaleDifference be will multiply with the x-, y- and zScale for the given point (i_IndexPhi,i_IndexTheta)

Parameters:
i_IndexPhi -
i_IndexTheta -
i_pointScaleDifference - This value will be multiply with x-, y- and zScale.

setPointScaleDifference

public void setPointScaleDifference(int i_IndexPhi,
                                    int i_IndexTheta,
                                    float i_pointScaleDifferenceX,
                                    float i_pointScaleDifferenceY,
                                    float i_pointScaleDifferenceZ)
Use this methode to change the scale of every point individually . The values i_pointScaleDifferenceX, i_pointScaleDifferenceY and i_pointScaleDifferenceZ be will multiply with the x-, y- and zScale for the given point (i_IndexPhi,i_IndexTheta)

Parameters:
i_IndexPhi -
i_IndexTheta -
i_pointScaleDifferenceX - This value will be multiply with xScale.
i_pointScaleDifferenceY - This value will be multiply with yScale.
i_pointScaleDifferenceZ - This value will be multiply with zScale.

getPointScaleDifference

                                       int i_IndexTheta)
Returns the 3 values that will be multiply with scaleX/Y/Z for the point (_IndexPhi, i_IndexTheta) as an float array (x,y,z).

Parameters:
i_IndexPhi -
i_IndexTheta -
Returns:
float

getBounds

public float[] getBounds()
Returns:
an array with the 6 bounding coordinates (maxX,minX,maxY,minY,maxZ,minZ) of the surface

initColors

public void initColors(int[] i_horizontalColors,
                       int[] i_verticalColors)
This will create a color gradient for the surface. You can use as many colors as you like. If you wanna have an end-to-end gradient the start an end color must be the same. Note that this methode creates horizontal and vertical gradients and blend them. If you only need horizontal OR vertical gradients use initVerticalColors or initHorizontalColors instead. The previous gradient will be overwritten. You can also use an also use an 2 dimesional int array (int[phiSteps][thetaSteps]) which will copy to the surface colors array. Note this will throw an error if the size not match to the surface color array.

Parameters:
i_horizontalColors - An array which holds the colors for the horizontal gradient.
i_verticalColors - An array which holds the colors for the vertical gradient.

initColors

public void initColors(int[][] c)

clearColors

public void clearColors()
Set the colors array to null.

initVerticalColors

public void initVerticalColors(int[] i_colors)
This will create a vertical color gradient for the surface. If you wanna have an end-to-end gradient the start an end color must be the same. The previous gradient will be overwritten.

Parameters:
i_colors - An array which holds the colors for the vertical gradient.

initHorizontalColors

public void initHorizontalColors(int[] i_colors)
This will create a horizontal color gradient for the surface. If you wanna have an end-to-end gradient the start an end color must be the same. The previous gradient will be overwritten.

Parameters:
i_colors - An array which holds the colors for the vertical gradient.

colors

public int[][] colors()
If you has set colors for your surface this function gives you an array which hold the color for every point of the surface. It's usefull to manipulate the colors and add them after this back to the surface by call the initColors methode.

Returns:
the array which holds the colors for every point

setTexture

public void setTexture(processing.core.PImage i_tex)
Set a texture for your surface. The texture will be drawn as patter on every quad of the surface.

Parameters:
i_tex - a PImage Image used as texture.

setTexture

public void setTexture(processing.core.PImage i_tex,
                       java.lang.String i_texMode)
Parameters:
i_texMode - The way the texture is used by the surface. "TILE" let the texture draw on every quad of the surface. "WHOLE" will spreading the texture over the entire surface.

setTextureMode

public void setTextureMode(java.lang.String i_texMode)
Set the way the texture is used by the surface.

Parameters:
i_texMode - The way the texture is used by the surface. "TILE" let the texture draw on every quad of the surface. "WHOLE" will spreading the texture over the entire surface.

clearTexture

public void clearTexture()
This will clear the texture that you have set with the setTexture method.

useVertexNormals

public void useVertexNormals(boolean b)
Turn on or off vertex normals. With vertex normals the surface will look much smoother. It doesen't works with pipes at the moment.

Parameters:
b -

updateMesh

public void updateMesh()
Updates the mesh, that is needed to calculate the vertex normals. Used after you change the coords or using getPointScaleDifference().

draw

public void draw()
The methode draws the full surface. If you have initialize your surface with colors, this colors will be used for stroke and fill otherwise the latest fill and stroke settings will be applied. Use noStroke or noFill before this methode to hide fills or strokes.

drawPart

public void drawPart(int i_startIndexPhi,
                     int i_endIndexPhi,
                     int i_startIndexTheta,
                     int i_endIndexTheta)
Draws the part of the surface between the passing bounding. If you wanna draw a hemisphere of your sphere surface for example you have to call drawPart(0,phiSteps,0,thetaSteps/2).

Parameters:
i_startIndexPhi - a value between 0 and the phiSteps your surface was initialized with
i_endIndexPhi - a value between i_startIndexPhi and the phiSteps your surface was initialized with
i_startIndexTheta - a value between 0 and the thetaSteps your surface was initialized with
i_endIndexTheta - a value between i_startIndexTheta and the thetaSteps your surface was initialized with

drawPart

public void drawPart(int i_startIndexPhi,
                     int i_endIndexPhi,
                     int i_startIndexTheta,
                     int i_endIndexTheta,
                     int i_stepPhi,
                     int i_stepTheta)
Parameters:
i_startIndexPhi - a value between 0 and the phiSteps your surface was initialized with
i_endIndexPhi - a value between i_startIndexPhi and the phiSteps your surface was initialized with
i_startIndexTheta - a value between 0 and the thetaSteps your surface was initialized with
i_endIndexTheta - a value between i_startIndexTheta and the thetaSteps your surface was initialized with
i_stepPhi - the steps size for phi; if i is 1 every segment will be drawn if its 2 only every second an so on
i_stepTheta - the steps size for theta; if j is 1 every segment will be drawn if its 2 only every second an so on

drawHorizontalStrip

public void drawHorizontalStrip(int i_indexTheta)
This draws a horizontal strip of the surface.

Parameters:
i_indexTheta - The number of the Strip you wanna draw. The number must lie in between 0 and the theatSteps your surface was initialized with.

drawHorizontalStrip

public void drawHorizontalStrip(int i_indexTheta,
                                int i_startIndexPhi,
                                int i_endIndexPhi)
Draws a horizontal strip at j between i_startIndexPhi and i_endIndexPhi

Parameters:
i_indexTheta - The number of the Strip you wanna draw. The number must lie in between 0 and the theatSteps your surface was initialized with.
i_startIndexPhi - Number of the first vertical element. The number must lie in between 0 and the phiSteps your surface was initialized with.
i_endIndexPhi - Number of the last vertical element. The number must lie in between i_startIndexPhi and the phiSteps your surface was initialized with.

drawHorizontalStrip

public void drawHorizontalStrip(int i_indexTheta,
                                float i_radius)
Draws a horizontal strip between two surfaces with different radiuses.

Parameters:
i_indexTheta - The number of the Strip you wanna draw. The number must lie in between 0 and the theatSteps your surface was initialized with.
i_radius - The radius of the inner surface.

drawHorizontalStrip

public void drawHorizontalStrip(int i_indexTheta,
                                int i_startIndexPhi,
                                int i_endIndexPhi,
                                float i_radius)
Draws a vertical strip between two surfaces with different radiuses.

Parameters:
i_indexTheta - The number of the Strip you wanna draw. The number must lie in between 0 and the theatSteps your surface was initialized with.
i_startIndexPhi - Number of the first vertical element. The number must lie in between 0 and the phiSteps your surface was initialized with.
i_endIndexPhi - Number of the last vertical element. The number must lie in between i_startIndexPhi and the phiSteps your surface was initialized with.
i_radius - Width of the strip.

drawHorizontalSegment

public void drawHorizontalSegment(int i_startIndexPhi,
                                  int i_startIndexTheta,
                                  int i_endIndexPhi,
                                  int i_endIndexTheta)
Draws horizontal Segments between the given parameters. This is called by drawPart() and drawHorizontalStrip().

Parameters:
i_startIndexPhi - Number of the first vertical element. The number must lie in between 0 and the phiSteps your surface was initialized with.
i_startIndexTheta - Number of the first horizontal element. The number must lie in between 0 and the thetaSteps your surface was initialized with.
i_endIndexPhi - Number of the last vertical element. The number must lie in between i_startIndexPhi and the phiSteps your surface was initialized with.
i_endIndexTheta - Number of the last horizontal element. The number must lie in between i_startIndexTheta and the thetaSteps your surface was initialized with.

drawHorizontalSegment

public void drawHorizontalSegment(int i_stripNumber,
                                  int i_startIndexPhi,
                                  int i_endIndexPhi,
                                  float i_radius)
Parameters:
i_stripNumber - The number must lie in between 0 and the thetaSteps your surface was initialized with.
i_startIndexPhi - The number must lie in between 0 and the phiSteps your surface was initialized with.
i_endIndexPhi - The number must lie in between i_startIndexPhi and the phiSteps your surface was initialized with.
i_radius - The radius of the inner surface.

Draws a part of horizontal line.

Parameters:
i_startIndexPhi - The number must lie in between 0 and the phiSteps your surface was initialized with.
i_endIndexPhi - The number must lie in between i_startIndexPhi and the phiSteps your surface was initialized with.
i_startIndexTheta - The number must lie in between 0 and the thetaSteps your surface was initialized with.
i_endIndexTheta - The number must lie in between i_startIndexTheta and and the thetaSteps your surface was initialized with.
i_stepPhi - The steps size for phi; if i is 1 every segment will be drawn if its 2 only every second an so on
i_stepTheta - The steps size for theta; if j is 1 every segment will be drawn if its 2 only every second an so on

drawHorizontalLineStrip

public void drawHorizontalLineStrip(int i_phiIndex)
Draws a horizontal line between the points p1(i_phiIndex, 0) and p2(i_phiIndex, thetaSteps).

Parameters:
i_phiIndex - The number must lie in between 0 and the phiSteps your surface was initialized with.

drawHorizontalLineStrip

public void drawHorizontalLineStrip(int i_phiIndex,
                                    int i_startIndexTheta,
                                    int i_endIndexTheta)
Draws a horizontal line between the points p1(i_phiIndex, i_startIndexTheta) and p2(i_phiIndex, i_endIndexTheta).

Parameters:
i_phiIndex - The number must lie in between 0 and the phiSteps your surface was initialized with.
i_startIndexTheta - The number must lie in between 0 and the thetaSteps your surface was initialized with.
i_endIndexTheta - The number must lie in between i_startIndexTheta and the thetaSteps your surface was initialized with.

drawHorizontalLineSegment

public void drawHorizontalLineSegment(int i_phiIndex,
                                      int i_thetaIndex)
Draws a horizontal line between the points p1(i_phiIndex, i_thetaIndex) and p2(i_phiIndex, i_thetaIndex + 1). This methode is called by drawHoritontalLines(), drawHorizontalLinePart(), drawHorizontalLineStrip().

Parameters:
i_phiIndex - The number must lie in between 0 and the phiSteps your surface was initialized with.
i_thetaIndex - The number must lie in between 0 and the thetaSteps your surface was initialized with.

drawVerticalLines

public void drawVerticalLines()
Draws all vertical lines on your surface.

drawVerticalLineStrip

public void drawVerticalLineStrip(int i_thetaIndex)
Draws a vertical line between the points p1(0, i_thetaIndex) and p2(phiSteps, i_thetaIndex).

Parameters:
i_thetaIndex - The number must lie in between 0 and the thetaSteps your surface was initialized with.

drawVerticalLineStrip

public void drawVerticalLineStrip(int i_thetaIndex,
                                  int i_startPhiIndex,
                                  int i_endPhiIndex)
Draws a vertical line between the points p1(i_startPhiIndex, i_thetaIndex) and p2(i_endPhiIndex, i_thetaIndex).

Parameters:
i_startPhiIndex - The number must lie in between 0 and the phiSteps your surface was initialized with.
i_endPhiIndex - The number must lie in between i_startPhiIndex and the phiSteps your surface was initialized with.
i_thetaIndex - The number must lie in between 0 and the thetaSteps your surface was initialized with.

drawVerticalLineSegment

public void drawVerticalLineSegment(int i_phiIndex,
                                    int i_thetaIndex)
Draws a vertical line between the points p1(i_phiIndex, i_thetaIndex) and p2(i_phiIndex + 1 or 0 if i_phiIndex < phiStep-1, i_thetaIndex). This methode is called by drawVerticalLines(), drawVerticalLinePart(), drawVerticalLineStrip().

Parameters:
i_phiIndex - The number must lie in between 0 and the phiSteps your surface was initialized with.
i_thetaIndex - The number must lie in between 0 and the thetaSteps your surface was initialized with.
